results.title: Challenge for change
results.creator_credit: Bill Reid and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 102 of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
‘Challenge for change’ is a community based government program. Its objective is to shed light on social problems through the production of films. What is Challenge for Change? What happens with children from deprived areas when they are given a free hand to make their own films? Who can be a better voice for Indian needs and aspirations than an Indian film crew? How angry are the black people with the way society treats them? How do government representatives react to social change and the role of the Challenge for Change program? Can a film project serve as a cohesive agent and catalyst for change within a community, and at the same time serve as a means of communication with government? What is community organizing? What role can film play in participatory democracy? Does controversy lead to violence? How useful are the films from Challenge for Change going to be? This film has some of the answers.

results.title: The Hydrogen atom as viewed by quantum mechanics
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Davidson Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
The model for the electron probability distribution in the hydrogen atom is provided by quantum mechanics. Confidence in this model is justified because the calculated energies agree closely with the experimental energies obtained from the hydrogen atom spectrum. The probability distribution of the electron is demonstrated by analogies. Animation shows the outstanding features of the hydrogen atom.

results.title: Electrochemical cells
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Shows construction and operation of an electrochemical cel1. Time lapse photography of the charges at the electrodes and animated diagrams of the cell processes show the nature of the electrode reactions, the motion of electron and ion currents and the relationship between concentrations and cell voltage Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Co-op housing: getting it together
results.creator_credit: Laura Sky, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
People, housing, funds and expertise: getting them together isn’t easy, but it can be done. The film deals with the planning and procedures involved in setting up a co-op, whether that means building one, or buying and rehabilitating existing housing. People living in different kinds of co-ops talk about them, and how they function.

results.title: Chemical families
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Davidson Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Starting with a display of samples of over 70 elements, the film demonstrates methods by which chemical similarities among the elements have provided the basis for dividing them logically into families. By experiment and observation metals, non-metals, and the doubtful elements are grouped. The film demonstrates how atomic numbers have provided the key to the ordering of the elements in the periodic table.

results.title: The Spring and fall of Nina Polanski
results.creator_credit: Louise Roy, Joan Hutton, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
An animation film depicting the life of a certain Nina Polanski, who could be any woman. She marries amidst much fanfare and photo-snapping, and settles into a domestic routine of cooking, washing dishes, ironing, and babies. Eventually she becomes the very machines she uses every day, until one day she walks into the woods and takes back her old self.
results.title_for_label: The Spring and fall of Nina Polanski
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Roy, Joan Hutton, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada

An animation film depicting the life of a certain Nina Polanski, who could be any woman. She marries amidst much fanfare and photo-snapping, and settles into a domestic routine of cooking, washing dishes, ironing, and babies. Eventually she becomes the very machines she uses every day, until one day she walks into the woods and takes back her old self.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
An animation film depicting the life of a certain Nina Polanski, who could be any woman. She marries amidst much fanfare and photo-snapping, and settles into a domestic routine of cooking, washing dishes, ironing, and babies. Eventually she becomes the very machines she uses every day, until one day she walks into the woods and takes back her old self.

results.title: Le-haut sur ces montagnes
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated interpretation of the French folk song “La-haut sur ces Montagnes” set on the island of Orleans near Quebec, where traditional dances and songs are kept alive by the peasant community. Featuring Madeleine Lachance and the Quatuor Alouette.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Palardy and National Film Board of Canada
